alert.note: Alert for Gogebic; Iron; Ontonagon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 1:46AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Iron, Gogebic and Ontonagon Counties through 245 AM EDT/145 AM CDT/... At 146 AM EDT/1246 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bessemer to Rice Creek Natural Area to 6 miles southwest of Willow Lake. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ontonagon, Bessemer, Wakefield, Marenisco, Watersmeet, Bergland, Rockland, Bruce Crossing, Paulding, Greenland, Norwich, Thomaston, Tamarack Lake, Trout Creek, Presque Isle Reservoir, Pomeroy Lake, Lake Gogebic State Park, Paint Lake, Clark Lake and White Pine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
